For the adults who want to imbibe, a splash of Scotch fits right.Ingredients10–12 servings33" cinnamon sticks14" piece ginger, thinly sliced lengthwise10whole cloves6cups pomegranate juice⅓cup sugar12oz. Scotch (optional)Club soda and lemon twists (for serving)PreparationStep 1Bring cinnamon sticks, ginger, cloves, pomegranate juice, and sugar to a boil in a medium saucepan. Cook until reduced to 1½ cups, about 40 minutes. Strain syrup through a fine-mesh sieve into a heatproof measuring glass; discard solids. Let cool.Step 2To serve, pour 1 oz. pomegranate syrup and 1 oz. Scotch, if using, into a tall ice-filled glass. Top off with club soda and stir to combine; garnish with a lemon twist.Step 3Do Ahead: Syrup can be made 10 days in ahead. Chill in an airtight container.How would you rate Shirley Tonic?Leave a ReviewTell us what you thinkReviews (2)Back to TopTriangleTried making this and must have overheated it or distilled it down too much. I ended up boiling down to a little over a cup and this was far too thick and hardened into something like rock hard inedible candy. Big bummer.AnonymousBerkeley, CA12/23/2020We enjoyed this! Nice spiced flavor in the syrup, and not too sweet. In fact, I think it could have been sweeter (perhaps we diluted too much with soda). I made a 1/3 batch, and we drank Oban because that was all I had. I would love to try with different scotches, perhaps something more peaty. This would make a lovely before dinner highball.SidneyPhiladelphia, PA12/16/2020Explore Bon AppétitCold DrinkDrinks AllCocktailAmericanPomegranateFruitCinnamonHerbs & SpicesGingerScotchAlcohol & Other DrinksEasyDrinksNonalcoholicHealthyishRecipes you want to make.
